conclusion: To solve for the magnetic field B, analyze the forces on wire ab in both scenarios.
When current I flows from a to b, wire experiences magnetic force due to field B.
Magnetic force on wire is given by F_B = I L B.
Tension in each spring scale balances weight of wire plus magnetic force.
Weight of wire per unit length is mg/L, total weight is mg.
Tension in each spring scale is T_1 = T_2 = mg + I L B.
Given reading of one spring scale is F_1: F_1 = mg + I L B.
When current is reversed and becomes 2I, direction of magnetic force changes.
New magnetic force is F_B' = 2I L B.
Tension in each spring scale is T_1' = T_2' = mg + 2I L B.
Given reading of one spring scale is F_2: F_2 = mg + 2I L B.
Subtract first equation from second: F_2 - F_1 = I L B.
Solve for B: B = (F_2 - F_1) / (I L).
Magnitude of magnetic field B is (F_2 - F_1) / (I L).
